bibl.title: The Crisis of the Mendesian Nome in the Reign of Marcus Aurelius.
bibl.note: The Mendesian Nome, and Egypt as a whole, suffered a lot under the reign of Marcus Aurelius as a result of accumulations of a burdensome taxation system which became even more excessive to face the exigencies of wars which were imposed on the Emperor.
ABD-EL-GHANY Mohammed El Sayed, The Crisis of the Mendesian Nome in the Reign of Marcus Aurelius.
